issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body:
This was missed in MAPREDUCE-3240.

Attached. Stupid little patch. But wasn't so easy figuring it out :)
looks good to me.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12501101/MAPREDUCE-3281-20111027.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 170 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed the unit tests build

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1174//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1174//artifact/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-mapreduce-client-common.html

I just committed this to trunk and branch-0.23 to unlock the build.

Still failing for me... re-opening

Seems to be failing for a different reason now

testContainerLaunch(org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.TestLinuxContainerExecutorWithMocks)  Time elapsed: 0.523 sec  <<< FAILURE!
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<0> but was:<126>
        at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
        at junit.framework.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:283)
        at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:64)
        at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:195)
        at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:201)
        at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.TestLinuxContainerExecutorWithMocks.testContainerLaunch(TestLinuxContainerExecutorWithMocks.java:118)

Looks like permisions issue
bash-3.2$ touch exec.sh
bash-3.2$ ./exec.sh
bash: ./exec.sh: Permission denied
bash-3.2$ echo $?
126
Somehow, this didn't show up in my env. Can you try this?

Test Results PASS with patch MAPREDUCE-3281-20111028.txt:

mvn -Dtest=TestLinuxContainerExecutorWithMocks#testContainerLaunch test

-------------------------------------------------------
 T E S T S
-------------------------------------------------------
Running org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.TestLinuxContainerExecutorWithMocks
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.537 sec

Results :

Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0

One minor related thing I see when running this test is some untracked files showing up in git. Probably a separate JIRA might be needed.

bash-3.2$ git status
# On branch branch-0.23
# Changes not staged for commit:
#   (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
#   (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
#
#       modified:   hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/test/resources/mock-container-executor
#
# Untracked files:
#   (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)
#
#       hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/main/c/container-executor/test-container-executor
#       hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/main/c/container-executor/test/test-container-executor.o
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
+1 patch looks good and fixes the test on my box.

Pushed the latest patch to trunk and branch-0.23. Closing this. Sorry for the trouble.

Thanks Jonathan for the verification. Also, please open a separate ticket for the above issue. Thanks!
